channel.title: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?

item.title: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Okay well I have a void witbht eh skillcape ifs and here they are:
You're under arrest for typing under the influence. Notice how you named the method SkillCape and called it as Skillcape (it should be named doCapeEmote or something similar to that, by the way); Java is a case sensitive language.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?

item.title: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

You’re not calling the correct method name; it’s ‘SkillCape’, not ‘Skillcape’ as Java is case sensitive.

case 52054: SkillCape(); break;

Read full topic
item.source: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?

item.title: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

that not creating the method for Skillcape(). Create a method for Skillcape and it will work.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] How to make a emote button activate skill emotes(I have codes)?
item.dc:creator: @skittle385 skittle385
item.description:
@skittle385 wrote:

Okay well I have a void with the skillcape ifs and here they are:

public void SkillCape() { if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4319) { stillgfx(465, absY, absX); setAnimation(2890); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4359) { stillgfx(481, absY, absX); stillgfx(2, absY, absX); setAnimation(2763); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4329) { setAnimation(2412); stillgfx(60, absY, absX); stillgfx(247, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4341) { setAnimation(3007); stillgfx(574, absY, absX); stillgfx(432, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4347) { setAnimation(1332); stillgfx(454, absY, absX); stillgfx(265, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4351) { setAnimation(427); stillgfx(243, absY, absX); stillgfx(472, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4333) { setAnimation(791); stillgfx(186, absY, absX); stillgfx(255, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4317) { setAnimation(1765); stillgfx(61, absY, absX); stillgfx(616, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4339) { setAnimation(1652); stillgfx(578, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4361) { setAnimation(881); stillgfx(582, absY, absX); stillgfx(577, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4327) { setAnimation(885); stillgfx(469, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4337) { setAnimation(921); stillgfx(333, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4355) { setAnimation(2836); stillgfx(352, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4345) { setAnimation(625); stillgfx(547, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4357) { setAnimation(898); stillgfx(148, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4335) { setAnimation(622); stillgfx(624, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4325) { setAnimation(883); stillgfx(563, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4321) { setAnimation(733); stillgfx(453, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4353) { setAnimation(2876); stillgfx(631, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4331) { setAnimation(2273); stillgfx(618, absY, absX); stillgfx(608, absY, absX); } if (playerEquipment[playerCape] == 4343) { setAnimation(2046); stillgfx(343, absY, absX); stillgfx(332, absY, absX); } }

But when i try to add it this is what I put and when I compile it says
client.java:24952: cannot find symbol
symbol: method Skillcape()
location: class client
Skillcape();

And this is the code I put for it:

case 52054: Skillcape(); break;
